Lack of credible sources: The expert points out that the claim does not provide any named sources or credible evidence to support the assertion that Ted Cruz is negotiating with Donald Trump to be his running mate. This raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Denial from Cruz: s campaign: The expert mentions that when asked about the claim, Cruz's campaign spokesman responded with an email calling the post "categorically false." This official denial adds weight to the skepticism surrounding the claim.
Inconsistencies in the timing: The expert highlights the confusion in the claim's timeline. It states that Cruz is negotiating with Trump after Marco Rubio dropped out of the race, but Rubio dropped out on March 15, 2016, while the claim was made on February 25, 2016. This discrepancy raises questions about the accuracy of the claim.
Lack of widespread coverage: The expert mentions that the claim was only found on the Elect Leaders website and had been shared on Facebook around 34,000 times. The limited coverage of the claim suggests that it may not have been widely reported or verified by reputable news sources.
